Package ui

Class Button

java.lang.Object
ui.Component
ui.Button
All Implemented Interfaces:
EngineComponent, UIMouseReactive
public class Button
extends Component
implements UIMouseReactive
The Button Component allows the user to interact with a visual element via mouse movement and clicks

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Button​(SnakeGame g, double X, double Y, double W, double H, Text t)
    Constructs a new instance of the Button class, setting the colours of the button to their default values.
    Button​(SnakeGame g, double X, double Y, Text t)
    Constructs a new instance of the Button class, setting the colours of the button to their default values, and setting the width and height to zero for later calculation based on text width/height
    Button​(SnakeGame g, Text t)
    Constructs a new instance of the Button class, setting the colours of the button to their default values, and setting the width, height, X and Y to zero for later calculation based on text width/height and alignment properties

    • Button

      public Button​(SnakeGame g, double X, double Y, double W, double H, Text t)
      Constructs a new instance of the Button class, setting the colours of the button to their default values.
      Parameters:
      g - The SnakeGame instance this Button belongs to
      X - The X position of this Button
      Y - The Y position of this Button
      W - The width of this Button
      H - The height of this Button
      t - The Text instance to display inside the Button

  • Method Details

    • onMouseEnter

      public void onMouseEnter​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
      Called by the UIController when the mouse is detected to have hovered over this Button. Sets the button to it's HOVERED state.
      Specified by:
      onMouseEnter in interface UIMouseReactive
      Parameters:
      event - The MouseEvent we're responding to

    • onMouseLeave

      public void onMouseLeave​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
      Called by the UIController when the mouse is no longer hovering over this this Button. Sets the Button to it's INACTIVE state.
      Specified by:
      onMouseLeave in interface UIMouseReactive
      Parameters:
      event - The MouseEvent we're responding to

    • onMouseDown

      public void onMouseDown​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event, boolean within)
      Called by the UIController when the mouse has depressed on top of this button. Sets the button to it's ACTIVE state.
      Specified by:
      onMouseDown in interface UIMouseReactive
      Parameters:
      event - The MouseEvent we're responding to
      within - Whether or not this mouse event occurred within the bounds of this Button

    • onMouseUp

      public void onMouseUp​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event, boolean within)
      Called by the UIController when the mouse is detected to have been released over this button. If the button is ACTIVE at the time (as in, has been clicked), the callback (if any) is executed.
      Specified by:
      onMouseUp in interface UIMouseReactive
      Parameters:
      event - The MouseEvent we're responding to
      within - Whether or not this mouse event occurred within the bounds of this Button
      See Also:
      activeCallback

    • isEntered

      public boolean isEntered()
      Determines whether or not this button is currently being hovered over by using the current state of this Button as the means.
      Specified by:
      isEntered in interface UIMouseReactive
      Returns:
      Returns true if this Button is being hovered over, false otherwise.

    • update

      public void update​(double dt)
      No need to update every tick; we only need to update when a mouse event occurs. This method exists only to satisfy the interface EngineComponent.
      Specified by:
      update in interface EngineComponent

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent()
      Redraws the button using the correct colours based on the state of the Button at the time of drawing.
      Specified by:
      paintComponent in interface EngineComponent
      See Also:
      state

    • center

      public Button center​(boolean horizontal, boolean vertical, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      A proxy method of Component::center used to avoid having to cast Component to Button every time. Using Generics would invalidate the type-safe nature of the class hierarchy, so this approach was used instead. Centers the text via the methods enabled. Will center horizontally only if horizontal param is true. Likewise with vertical. The xOffset and yOffset will be applied to the X and Y position after centering has completed.
      Overrides:
      center in class Component
      Parameters:
      horizontal - If true, centers the component horizontally
      vertical - If true, centers the component vertically
      xOffset - The offset applied to the X position
      yOffset - The offset applied to the Y position
      Returns:
      Returns the Button instance, to enable method chaining
